newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan Feb leading index 44.4, coincident 75.0 -- EPA.
newsitem.headline: Japan Feb leading index 44.4, coincident 75.0 -- EPA.

text.p: Japan's diffusion index of leading economic indicators stood at 44.4 on a scale of 100 in February, the Economic Planning Agency (EPA) said on Monday.
A breakdown of the indices of economic indicators follows:
The index of leading indicators was below 50 for the second successive month in February.
The index of coincident indicators was above 50 for the sixth month in a row, while the lagging indicators index was below 50 for the second successive month.

A figure for the index of leading economic indicators above 50, the so-called "boom or bust" mark, is generally taken as suggesting the economy will expand in the coming months, while a figure below 50 suggests the economy will contract in the coming months.
The coincident index measures current economic conditions, while the lagging index traces economic trends in the past few months.
